page.title: 15BECKWITHSHAW GALA DAY
page.content: This is a very important village event and everyone helps with it. It is held on the football field annually on Bank Holiday Monday. In 1985 admission was 20p for children and cars and 30p for adults. It starts at 2pm with a Fancy dress parade and then the crowning of the Gala Queen who always comes from Beckwithshaw. There are races,sweet stalls and games such as a coconut shy, throwing the wellie,pillow fights,a bouncey castle,ride a donkey, a raffle and a tombola. To watch there is country dancing,a pet show, a puppet show and a tug of war. There are tea and biscuits in the Beckwithshaw village hall. It finishes at about 5pm and at 7pm there is a disco in the village hall.
